column4: ty. in gparted it has a mount point of /media/randomstringofletters how do change the mount point to /media/data ?
Its called /data but isnt the mount point /media/data ?
Does /data exist? AFAICT, its telling you that it does not (you said yourself it should be /media/data which sounds more like it anyway)
Is it mounting to /media/disk ok now?
The output of mount should tell you if its mounted
sorry but what do you mean the output of mount?
In your terminal, type mount and press enter. It is a command
and that is the random string gparted is giving too right?
It sounds to me like you are telling it to mount to a location that doesnt exist
Right so create the directory first with sudo mkdir /media/data
Then set fstab to point to /media/data to mount sda6
If it cant find the mount point, it just creates a temporary mount point and calls it by UUID since this value is unique
If ls -l /media/data shows it does exists as a directory
Why do you keep looking at gparted? You should be looking at mount and /etc/fstab
